body_html:
So @carpodaster I updated the PR according to your feedback and added the comment feature as well. Sorry it took me so long, I had a deadline at work and then a 2 day project out of town.

Quick note on how I implemented the comments:
Notes by mentors on applications for their projects are internally represented as Comments in the mentor namespace -> Mentor::Comment and use the Comment table under the hood. It was not possible / is super difficult to just use the existing Comment model with it's polymorphic Commentable association, since there are already comments on applications. Including the mentor's personal notes here would cause confusion in other parts of the application plus interfere in the project proposal logic.
Using the exiting Note model is also impossible - they are only tied to a user (and I did not want to change this).

So the Mentor::Comment is just a Comment, not interfering with other comments and each mentor only has one per Mentor::Application, using it as a kind of personal notes field that she can also empty again.

missing:
What is still missing, is a navigation for mentors to these views. I did not know where to add them, since there was ongoing work on the navigation. For now, we can just replace the submit your project button once we need it there. But I wanted to look into this again on the weekend, maybe adding a dropdown to the navbar...?

body:
So @carpodaster I updated the PR according to your feedback and added the comment feature as well. Sorry it took me so long, I had a deadline at work and then a 2 day project out of town.

Quick note on how I implemented the comments:
**Notes** by mentors on applications for their projects are internally represented as `Comment`s in the mentor namespace -> `Mentor::Comment` and use the `Comment` table under the hood. It was not possible / is super difficult to just use the existing `Comment` model with it's polymorphic `Commentable` association, since there are already comments on applications. Including the mentor's personal notes here would cause confusion in other parts of the application plus interfere in the project proposal logic.
Using the exiting `Note` model is also impossible - they are only tied to a user *(and I did not want to change this)*.

So the `Mentor::Comment` is just a `Comment`, not interfering with other comments and each mentor only has one per `Mentor::Application`, using it as a kind of personal notes field that she can also empty again.

**missing:**
What is still missing, is a navigation for mentors to these views. I did not know where to add them, since there was ongoing work on the navigation. For now, we can just replace the `submit your project` button once we need it there. But I wanted to look into this again on the weekend, maybe adding a dropdown to the navbar...?
